body_html:
@ciphx see if you can reproduce the problem. If you can, try removing parts of GA3C, checking if the problem still occurs as you remove pieces of it. The goal would be to get a small and simple piece of code that reproduces the problem.

You can also enable verbose logging and look at the __LOG_MEMORY__ messages to see if there are many Tensors being allocated without being deallocated.
body_text:
@ciphx see if you can reproduce the problem. If you can, try removing parts of GA3C, checking if the problem still occurs as you remove pieces of it. The goal would be to get a small and simple piece of code that reproduces the problem.
You can also enable verbose logging and look at the __LOG_MEMORY__  messages to see if there are many Tensors being allocated without being deallocated.
body:
@ciphx see if you can reproduce the problem. If you can, try removing parts of GA3C, checking if the problem still occurs as you remove pieces of it. The goal would be to get a small and simple piece of code that reproduces the problem.

You can also enable verbose logging and look at the \_\_LOG_MEMORY\_\_  messages to see if there are many Tensors being allocated without being deallocated.
